Articles.Content: Is there a way to find out what science I am missing from a planet or biome?
Check the ksp wiki for a list of biomes and experiments, and the science archives tab in the R&D screen to see what you have. I have a page in my ksp spreadsheet for keeping track

Check the ksp wiki for a list of biomes and experiments, and the science archives tab in the R&D screen to see what you have. I have a page in my ksp spreadsheet for keeping track

I was really hoping the science center within KSP would somehow reveal that. Kinda dumb I have to maintain a spreadsheet.

Hoping .90 has an adjustment to this.

Not too long ago there was a website where you could drag&drop your persistent.sfs file. It resulted in a detailed page listing all science you had already done and what was still to be gained.

Sadly I have no idea about the sites address and whether or not is still operational.
There's also a mod for that.

There's also a mod for that.

I'll have to download that tonight and give it a try.

Seems exactly what I am looking for.

ty
